1.text: I say then, Has God cast away his people? God forbid. For I also am an Israelite, of the seed of Abraham, of the tribe of Benjamin.

2.text: God has not cast away his people which he foreknew. Know you not what the scripture said of Elias? how he makes intercession to God against Israel saying,

3.text: Lord, they have killed your prophets, and dig down your altars; and I am left alone, and they seek my life.

4.text: But what said the answer of God to him? I have reserved to myself seven thousand men, who have not bowed the knee to the image of Baal.

5.text: Even so then at this present time also there is a remnant according to the election of grace.

6.text: And if by grace, then is it no more of works: otherwise grace is no more grace. But if it be of works, then it is no more grace: otherwise work is no more work.

7.text: What then? Israel has not obtained that which he seeks for; but the election has obtained it, and the rest were blinded.

8.text: (According as it is written, God has given them the spirit of slumber, eyes that they should not see, and ears that they should not hear;) to this day.

9.text: And David said, Let their table be made a snare, and a trap, and a stumbling block, and a recompense to them:

10.text: Let their eyes be darkened, that they may not see, and bow down their back always.

11.text: I say then, Have they stumbled that they should fall? God forbid: but rather through their fall salvation is come to the Gentiles, for to provoke them to jealousy.

12.text: Now if the fall of them be the riches of the world, and the diminishing of them the riches of the Gentiles; how much more their fullness?

13.text: For I speak to you Gentiles, inasmuch as I am the apostle of the Gentiles, I magnify my office:

14.text: If by any means I may provoke to emulation them which are my flesh, and might save some of them.

15.text: For if the casting away of them be the reconciling of the world, what shall the receiving of them be, but life from the dead?

16.text: For if the first fruit be holy, the lump is also holy: and if the root be holy, so are the branches.

17.text: And if some of the branches be broken off, and you, being a wild olive tree, were grafted in among them, and with them partake of the root and fatness of the olive tree;

18.text: Boast not against the branches. But if you boast, you bore not the root, but the root you.

19.text: You will say then, The branches were broken off, that I might be grafted in.

20.text: Well; because of unbelief they were broken off, and you stand by faith. Be not high minded, but fear:

21.text: For if God spared not the natural branches, take heed lest he also spare not you.

22.text: Behold therefore the goodness and severity of God: on them which fell, severity; but toward you, goodness, if you continue in his goodness: otherwise you also shall be cut off.

23.text: And they also, if they abide not still in unbelief, shall be grafted in: for God is able to graft them in again.

24.text: For if you were cut out of the olive tree which is wild by nature, and were grafted contrary to nature into a good olive tree: how much more shall these, which be the natural branches, be grafted into their own olive tree?

25.text: For I would not, brothers, that you should be ignorant of this mystery, lest you should be wise in your own conceits; that blindness in part is happened to Israel, until the fullness of the Gentiles be come in.

26.text: And so all Israel shall be saved: as it is written, There shall come out of Sion the Deliverer, and shall turn away ungodliness from Jacob:

27.text: For this is my covenant to them, when I shall take away their sins.

28.text: As concerning the gospel, they are enemies for your sakes: but as touching the election, they are beloved for the fatherâ€™s sakes.

29.text: For the gifts and calling of God are without repentance.

30.text: For as you in times past have not believed God, yet have now obtained mercy through their unbelief:

31.text: Even so have these also now not believed, that through your mercy they also may obtain mercy.

32.text: For God has concluded them all in unbelief, that he might have mercy on all.

33.text: O the depth of the riches both of the wisdom and knowledge of God! how unsearchable are his judgments, and his ways past finding out!

34.text: For who has known the mind of the Lord? or who has been his counselor?

35.text: Or who has first given to him, and it shall be recompensed to him again?

36.text: For of him, and through him, and to him, are all things: to whom be glory for ever. Amen.
